author: pawandhananjay
content:
Have other clients implemented the v2 blobsbyrange/root rpc protocol for electra https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/p2p-interface.md#blobsidecarsbyroot-v2 ?
 seems like the only difference between v1 and v2 versions is the length of the list. Not sure when we typically bump rpc protocol versions but doing this for a length increase seems unnecessary imo. Do other clients think this is good to have?

author: jtraglia
content: Hmm yeah I’m not sure this is necessary either. I thought we bumped the version to prevent any confusion around the fork. But as you mentioned privately, we didn’t bump the version of BlocksByRange/Root v2 in Deneb under similar circumstances.

author: terencechain
content: I agree. It doesnt seem necessary to have

author: tersec
content: yeah, I didn't see any other differences either, and tend to agree

author: nc1234
content: We questioned the same thing in lodestar. It also presents some implementation challenges to us. Don’t think it is really necessary

author: terencechain
content: Thanks for the PR, we will want this for devnet5 right?

author: jtraglia
content: I think we should try to include it in devnet5.

author: terencechain
content: +1, we should add it to the list. cc <@199561711278227457>

author: jtraglia
content: I've added it to the consensus specs section.
